definition: to act in a fit of pique/to get in a huff/to be peeved
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: A wilful child in my heart never accept hia grow-up.
sentences.chinese: 的小孩，赌气着，不肯承认长大的事实。

sentences.english: Maybe she just went away in a fit of pique, when she is not angry,she will be back.
sentences.chinese: 或许她只是一时赌气出走，等她气消了自然会回来的。

sentences.english: He left in a fit of pique, demonstrating that he was treated unfairly.
sentences.chinese: 他一赌气就走了，一边抗议他被不公平的对待。

sentences.english: The child took sulks, and would not eat.

definition: to be difficult with sb/to provoke disagreement/at loggerheads/to fall out with
variant of 慪氣|怄气[ou4 qi4]
so angry it's unbearable/bitter about unbearable grievances
to be at loggerheads/to have a falling out
in a fit of pique/in a fury
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
to be in a bad mood
